articles.author: Jenni Reid, Hannah Ward-Glenton
articles.title: European markets lower after central bank rate hike and flurry of earnings reports - CNBC
articles.description: European markets lower as investors continue to digest the European Central Bank's decision to raise its interest rate by 75 basis points.

articles.title: Oil falls as China widens COVID-19 curbs; still set for weekly gain - Reuters.com
articles.description: Oil prices fell on Friday after China, the world's top crude oil importer, widened its COVID-19 curbs, but were poised for a weekly gain on supply concerns ahead of Europe's pending cut-off of Russian imports.
articles.content: SINGAPORE, Oct 28 (Reuters) - Oil prices fell on Friday after China, the world's top crude oil importer, widened its COVID-19 curbs, but were poised for a weekly gain on supply concerns ahead of Euro… [+2396 chars]

articles.title: Porsche and Lamborghini get stay of execution on Europe's petrol car ban - Drive
articles.description: Low-volume carmakers will get an extra year to comply with a European ban on engines, while synthetic fuels will become part of the solution.
articles.content: Lamborghini and other manufacturers with new-car registrations of less than 10,000 annually will now have until 2036 to comply with the rules, according to a report by Automotive News Europe, while p… [+107 chars]

articles.title: Apple exec confirms iPhones will switch to USB-C because 'we have no choice' - The Register
articles.description: Sure you have a choice. You could abandon the European market
articles.content:
Apple exec Greg "Joz" Joswiak has confirmed that the company will follow the European Union's requirement for mobile devices to use USB-C by 2024, which was signed into law on Monday.
